data.name: HT_Parallel
data.value: The number of servers to perform queries against in parallel

data.name: HT_Retries
data.value: The number of times to retry queries on servers that error (or timeout)

data.name: HT_Timeout
data.value: The timeout (in ms) to be used when querying each DNS Server

data.name: HT_Run
data.value: Get DNS propagation info for a URL

data.name: EX_Query_Reliable_On_Continents
data.value: Query the top 3 most reliable servers in Africa and North America as well as 8.8.8.8

data.name: EX_Json_Fields_Output
data.value: Output specific fields of results as json

data.name: HT_Run_Hostname
data.value: The Hostname you would like to see propagation for.

data.name: HT_Run_Custom_Server_File
data.value: Use the specified DNS server list for this run.

data.name: HT_Run_Servers
data.value: The servers to query against instead of the integrated servers. Specify a single value ("8.8.8.8") or multiple separated by commas ("8.8.8.8","2001:4860:4860::8888").

data.name: HT_Run_Server_Count
data.value: dug runs queries against the top servers, ranked by reliability, per continent. This allows you to set how many servers from each continent to use.

data.name: HT_Run_Continents
data.value: The continents on which servers will be queried. Defaults to all.

data.name: HT_Run_Query_Types
data.value: The query type(s) to run against each server. Specify a single value (A) or multiple separated by commas (A,MX).

data.name: HT_Run_Multiple_Server_Sources
data.value: When specifying servers (-s, --servers) or (-f, --file) also use integrated servers

data.name: HT_Run_Data_Columns
data.value: Specify the fields, and their order, in the file specified with (-f). Must be used with (-f). Options: ipaddress,countrycode,city,dnssec,reliability,ignore

data.name: ER_Run_Data_Columns_Without_Server_File
data.value: --data-columns cannot be used without specifying a server file (-f)

data.name: ER_Run_Unable_Parse_Data_Column_Header
data.value: Unable to parse provided column header:

data.name: HT_Run_Data_Headers_Present
data.value: Specifies whether or not headers are present in the file specified with (-f). Can only be used in conjunction with --data-columns

data.name: HT_Run_Data_Separator
data.value: Specifies the separator to be used when parsing servers from the file specified with (-f). Can only be used in conjunction with --data-columns. Assumes ',' if not set.

data.name: HT_Run_Template
data.value: Specify which data, and in what order, to put into out. Ignored if --output-format=TABLES. Options: ipaddress,countrycode,city,dnssec,reliability,continentcode,countryname,countryflag,citycountryname,citycountrycontinentname,responsetime,recordtype,haserror,errormessage,errorcode,value

data.name: ER_Run_Unable_Parse_Template_Header
data.value: Unable to parse provided output-template header:

data.name: HT_Run_Output_Format
data.value: Specify the output format. For formats other than the default you must also specify a template (--output-template). Options: CSV,JSON

data.name: ER_Run_Output_Format_Requires_Template
data.value: A template (--output-template) is required when using an output-format other than the default

data.name: HT_Run_Table_Detail_Level
data.value: Specify the level of detail to show when rendering tables. Ignored if output-format is set to anything other than its default (TABLES)

data.name: ER_Run_Table_Detail_Out_Of_Range
data.value: The specified table-detail is out of range. Valid values are in the range [1-2]

data.name: HT_Update
data.value: Update DNS server list with any new unique servers. Uses remote server to get list by default.

data.name: EX_Remote_Import_And_Update
data.value: Import servers from remote source, then update all servers' reliability

data.name: EX_Remote_Import_And_Update_Prune
data.value: Import servers from remote source, then update all servers' reliability. Remove servers that fail

data.name: EX_Update_Reliability_Prune_2_Retries
data.value: Update server reliability, remove any that fail. Also use up to 2 retries when querying each server

data.name: HT_Update_Custom_Server_File
data.value: Update DNS server list using the specified file instead of the remote source

data.name: HT_Update_Servers
data.value: The server IPs to import instead of the remote source. Specify a single value ("8.8.8.8") or multiple separated by commas ("8.8.8.8","2001:4860:4860::8888").

data.name: HT_Update_Overwrite
data.value: Overwrite the current server list instead of updating it.

data.name: HT_Update_Reliability
data.value: Runs a query for a very stable domain (google.com) against ALL servers. Can be set to 'normal' or 'prune'. Normal updates server reliability based on the results, Prune removes servers that failed (timeout, error, etc)

data.name: HT_Update_Reliability_Only
data.value: Can only be used with the (-r,--reliability) option. This will keep any new servers from other options (-s,-f,etc) or remote sources from being added. Use if you only want to update the reliability of the currently present servers

data.name: HT_Update_Update_URL
data.value: Specifies the remote URL to use to retrieve servers. To use this you must also set --data-columns so the servers can be deserialized

data.name: ER_Update_Update_URL_Requires_Data_Columns
data.value: --data-columns must be specified when using a custom update URL (--update-url)

data.name: HT_Update_Data_Columns
data.value: Specify the fields, and their order, of the data being imported. Applies to data imported from a file (-f) or remotely (--update-url). Use individually or specify multiple fields separated by commas. Options: ipaddress,countrycode,city,dnssec,reliability,ignore

data.name: ER_Update_Unable_Parse_Data_Column_Header
data.value: Unable to parse provided column header:

data.name: HT_Update_Data_Headers_Present
data.value: Specifies whether or not headers are present on the data being imported. Can only be used in conjunction with --data-columns

data.name: HT_Update_Data_Separator
data.value: Specifies the separator to be used when parsing import data. Can only be used in conjunction with --data-columns. Assumes ',' if not set.

data.name: Output_Added_X_Servers_Provided_Already_Present
data.value: Added {0} DNS Servers. The provided server(s) are already present.

data.name: Output_Loaded_X_Servers_From_Included_Source
data.value: Loaded {0} DNS Servers from built-in source

data.name: ER_Unable_To_Get_Value_From_Header_X_Expected_At_Index_X
data.value: Unable to retrieve expected value from specified header: {0}. Expected to be at index {1}

data.name: ER_Unable_Set_Field_X_To_Value_X
data.value: Unable to set field {0} to provided value: {1}. This might be a header trying to be parsed as a value, try adding --data-headers-present

data.name: ER_Unable_Render_Results_In_Format
data.value: Unable to render results in specified format {0}

data.name: ER_Unable_Resolve_Header
data.value: Unable to determine how to resolve specified header: {0}

data.name: Output_Animation_Disabled
data.value: Progress Animation disabled during verbose output

data.name: ER_Hostname_Missing
data.value: A {0} must be provided. (run dug help or dug --help for more info)

data.name: ER_Unable_To_Parse_File
data.value: Unable to parse content from specified file: {0} Consider using --data-columns

data.name: Output_Testing_Server_Responses_Finished
data.value: Finished, got {0} good responses out of {1} requests
